intro: Urostachys linifolius, commonly known as the silverleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which helps reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert habitats. Urostachys linifolius is a low-growing perennial with a compact, mat-like structure.
